reviews.title: Great value for money
reviews.text: Spent two nights here and had a wonderful stay as you have Glendalough on the doorstep and the bistro food was amazing. Rooms are clean and comfortable but a tad old fashioned which in our view added to the charm of the place. Overall I would recommend highly and great value on a dinner B and B rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night in the Glendalough Hotel in November. We stayed there because we were going walking in the area and it seems like the perfect base.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, disappointing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the up side, it's in the most spectacular location, so you find yourself willing to forgive a lot. A river ran under our window and the mountain, covered in forest, stretched up behind.
reviews.title: Quaint, Fabulous food

reviews.text: We had a gorgeous dinner in the main restaurant and were very pleasantly surprised by the whole experience, given the general condition of the bar/lounge and reception area. Breakfast in the same room was also great.
reviews.title: Where are all the standards?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was basic but clean, quiet, warm and spacious with a fab view.
reviews.title: Peace and Quiet...except for!

reviews.text: The best thing by far about the Glendalough Hotel is its amazing setting. The staff at the hotel (at reception) were always helpful - the staff at the Tavern and the Dining Room were also helpful but they were stretched so thinly that they were run off their feet. My room was nice but quite small - I had to place the kettle on the floor to use it as there was no plug socket on the bench. The bathroom was also very small - I was pleased that I was staying alone in the room rather than travelling with my husband. I would recommend this hotel as a good place to stay as it is well located for the walking tracks and the beautiful scenery of Glendalough.
reviews.title: Beautiful location and a nice hotel

reviews.text: For such a wonderful majical place, we had great expectations. The problems began after we were allocated our room, it was in the old part of the hotel, very cramped with oversized wardrobes, the bathroom floor was slooping and gave a very unsteady feeling. the decor was horrendus. Old dated wallpaper, the windows were dirty, cobwebs and stains on the window sills. The room was freezing cold, not good enough when you are travelling with a baby. We were assured the heat would be turned on later in the evening but this just didn't happen. The bar area was devoid of any athmosphere. The breakfast wasn't very interesting, poor selection of everything you would expect, hardly any yogarts, friut, bread, cereal. I think this hotel is capitalising on its location, I know 1 thing for sure we won't ever stay here again.
reviews.title: A Big Let Down

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for a conference but I think I would come back again to explore the area in more detail. Really nice hotel located in the National Park. This is an absolute gem if you wish to explore the surrounding mountains and monastic site.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a lovely setting under the mountains

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night for the "Helping the Hills" Conference organised by Mountaineering Ireland. I arrived early in the morning of the first day and my bedroom was ready for me. There were well over a hundred delegates attending. Both lunch and dinner were well prepared and served with friendly efficiency. Breakfast next day was very good before a wet and windy morning in the mountains. We arrived back to a good cooked lunch. The arrangements and conference facilities are excellent and the hotel should be commended for this. My bedroom was good and comfortable and there is free wi-fi downstairs.
reviews.title: Right up there!

reviews.text: I stayed recently to walk in the valley. I arrived in the hotel late, but the restaurant managed to fit me in and I had a lovely meal with good friendly service. The following morning, I awoke to a beautiful view and the sound of the river babbling by. I walked the spink very early and was back in time for a hearty breakfast. I was impressed by the value for money and quality of the welcome.
reviews.title: Stunning location and a great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a bit put off by some of the reviews of the Glendalough Hotel, but went with an open mind. The hotel is dated and there is a bit of wear and tear, but it is one of the homeliest hotels I have ever stayed in. The breakfast service was great. We ate in the restaurant and couldn't find fault with the food or the service either. The bedroom was cosy. The shower was good. If you were being very picky, you could point out certain things like coffee stains on tables etc, but it didn't spoil our experience one bit. I always feel very elated when I am in such a lovely setting. Glendalough is one of my favourite places in the world. Having a nice bedroom to flop down into after a long walk, did us the world of good. We will be back here. We liked it
reviews.title: Had a nice time here. Very restful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for a weekend. The service was very slow at dinner, I had to wait 40 mins for my main course, not to mention the fact that the waitress FORGOT my breakfast and another hour to wait for a hard boiled egg... But the fact that not only I paid in cash, but they had to take authorisation of my debit for the entire amount of the stay, telling me it would have been released the day after, this never happened, my bank statement showing me a charge of a 155 euros they were not able to unblock (for "technical difficulties") after a call with the receptionist, nobody apologized and they just told me "it would be released in two weeks" Seriously???
reviews.title: Don't let them take your card. They'll block your money for 2 weeks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for one night in the Glendalough Hotel, with my husband and a few family members, to celebrate my birthday. It was in February and it was a snowy weekend in the valley. On Saturday afternoon and Sunday morning we went for long walks through the valley, which is one of the most beautiful places in Ireland. It was wonderful to wake up and be in this place, to be able to step outside the door and walk by the lake, through the ancient monastic settlement.
reviews.title: Glendalough

reviews.text: We had a very good dinner on Saturday night. The food is very good here, and good value.
reviews.title: Amazing anniversary stay

reviews.text: We came for a birthday and wedding anniversary treat in February. We had great deal on three night stay including dinner all nights. Our room was on corner with gorgeous views over the gateway to the monastic city and the river. The staff were so friendly and we really relaxed here. Our dinners were lovely. We are looking for a new family hotel after an old favourite closed in Donegal and we think this is it! The new generation of family get togethers!
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.text: We booked this hotel at the last minute as we were struggling to find accomodation in the Dublin area over the weekend on 31/08 due to a number of sporting events. We had originally booked for 3 (including b/b) for 260 euro but day before we were due to arrive we increased our party to 4. We contacted the hotel who gave us, what we thought a very reasonable rate of 320 euro. Ten minutes after we confirmed our agreement, they phoned us back and stated that they could offer us a better deal (280 euro). We were very impressed. We arrived at the hotel and found it very attractive and located in one of the most beautiful areas of Southern Ireland. As we had been on the road for nearly 5 hours we decided to have a meal in the hotel rather than travelling out. We had a fabulous meal which included wine and drinks for 150 euro. Service at both the meal and the accomodation was second to none and we would recommend it as both a place to relax but also a great base for those who like to walk as the scenery and walking facilities were second to none. We will be back
reviews.title: Weekend Break

reviews.text: We stayed for our 10th anniversary & had a lovely stay. We did a mid-week deal for €150 which included dinner b&b, excellent value. Our room was on a beautiful corner overlooking the river, lovely big room. The dinner was fantastic too. Couldn't fault anything. We'll be back!
reviews.title: Picturesque Area

reviews.text: Came back here today after a few good experiences here.Met by waitess/barman. I wont say if it was male or female. Where has all the Irish charm gone. (immigrated i guess) No manners what so ever,spent more time chatting to theyre friend at bar. Never ever will i go back here. Food was complete crap too. I actually cant get over how rude this person was. I though no maybe its just a cultural thing and I dont understand the way eastern europeans behave but my friend who with me said they were really rude and he's eastern european also.
reviews.title: rude

reviews.text: As outlined by other reviewer the hotel is in an fantastic location. The hotel could do with a refurbishment however the room was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. We were staying in the hotel to attend the wedding and the food was fantastic. If you want to stay in Glendalough for a few days you won't find a better place.
reviews.title: Love old fashioned hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a stunning location, and we enjoyed many walks. The hotel is very quaint in character and at first I thought the rooms could do with an upgrade, but the place seems to grow on you and you look past the faded bedspread and 1980's lampshades. The bed was very comfortable with crisp clean sheets and blankets! bathroom has a very good power shower,hairdryer (bit on the slow side, ladies bring your own) and plenty of fluffy towels. The room also has a kettle and tea/coffee/milk etc. Breakfast was included in our rate and we thought it was excellent, with full Irish cooked to order. The hotel was very busy during our stay but the staff appeared to cope very well, one waiter in particular shone out for us at breakfast, the service was brilliant. Evening meals in our opinion are expensive 32 euros each for 2 courses, although the bar/lounge serves food at reasonable prices. All in all we felt we got good value for money and we would return.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, in a fantastic location
